column4: damn, I don't have a home, and no browser want to run without home
lol, I must browse as root
how on earth did your home disappear?!?
it doesn't disapeared, I can't mount it
oh, it was on another partition?
but in fact I wanted to install 2.6.9 kernel, but I realised I installed unstable kernel
maybe try using a LiveCD or something -- I guess the filesystem drivers in 2.6.9 are borked -- and try mounting /home from there.
I am serching how to have a bigger resolution in the fb

that happens to me every so often too... if you still have Nautilus running (i.e., you still have icons on your desktop) you can right-click on the desktop, choose 'Run terminal', then go 'killall gnome-panel' (without the quotation marks), and the panels will die... then GNOME will (should) automatically restart the panels.
fortunately I have a consol because it was savec in the last session
does this happen every time you start up your user session?

if you have any programs that you've set to start up automatically (e.g., gaim, Skype, or a wallpaper changer), you'll lose those settings, but hopefully that's no big loss if you can get your panels back...
